reviews.text: The train service is good, frequent trains to Southend and London. Station itself is average. Modern building with step free access to the platforms. However there are poor ticketing facilities, there are only two ticket machines which leads to large queues at peak times. Often witness people avoiding the ticket barriers, and not much seems to be done about it, which is frustrating for those who actually pay.

I have just paid an expensive ticket and also ended up losing my train because the lady on ticket office was that inefficient that after 12 minutes there she concluded she had no idea how to print a Network Railcard or which one it is- she was actually asking the clients. Horrible service- not happy at all

Ticket machines break down constantly. 
Sometimes the ticket office closes before 8pm and I can't buy my ticket for the next day because the new machines don't allow you to buy next day tickets. There's often a long queue outside the station the next morning.
The train ticket machine never works...

Hello you have just ended up in Basildon, home to chavs and other miscellaneous ranging from drugs to knife crime.         

Every corner you turn your life has a chance of being in danger, BASILDON is a no go zone.. 

Girls from here average a baby and wear skinny joggers and other attire to try and show off to people for relevance how ever the fact is everything they have is cheap. They also have a spiteful attitude towards anyone who doesn’t bend over and be their loyal dog.

Honestly I came here one day to experience a new world from my average day, I’m atheist but god this was hell.beggers everywhere along with homeless people. The shop workers at McDonald’s have tooth gaps, and to top it off shoe zone is a famous thing here!!!😱🥶😂😂

If you end up here you need to escape now before your life is endangered to gangs such as SS15 or tkway. One time I was circled by Carrara’s and I got robbed. This is my warning to you , have a good day
